N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 30.4 - Registration

State Regulations

An application for fleet registration or renewal shall be
made on a permanent fleet registration application form at the Division of

Field Services, Permanent Fleet Registration, Swan Street Building, Empire

State Plaza, Albany, NY 12228-0432. A registrant does not have to register all
of its vehicles as fleet vehicles in order to participate in the fleet
registration program, but must register the minimum number established by the
commissioner to be eligible. (a) Documents. (1)

Each registrant of a
participating fleet shall be assigned a five digit account number for each
address of that fleet or portion of that fleet. (2)

Registrants of vehicles participating in
the fleet registration program shall be issued a distinctive vehicle sticker
and a distinctive registration document for each vehicle. For passenger and
commercial vehicles, the sticker is to be displayed on the inside lower left
front windshield. For trailers and special purpose commercial vehicles, the
sticker is to be prominently displayed on the outside rear of the
vehicle. (b) Entry. After application is made, the registrant will receive a test tape listing
vehicles registered by that registrant. This tape must be reviewed, edited, and
returned. The registrant will then be sent a conversion tape of eligible fleet
vehicles and a bill. Fee computation will be based on an October 31st date, for
proration purposes. There is no proration for the flat $10 fee for special
purpose commercial vehicles or for trailers with an unladen weight of less than
1,000 pounds. (c) Fee payment. (1)

Registration fee payment shall be due by

October 31st of each year. A single payment per account must be submitted via
tape for all of the fleet's participating vehicles. (See I/O specifications in
paragraph [2] of this subdivision.)

(d) Heavy vehicle Federal highway
use tax. Registrants are required to submit the appropriate heavy vehicle
highway use tax paperwork with the conversion tape and subsequent renewal tapes
for all vehicles weighing 55,000 pounds or more. Notes
